# ðŸš€ Feature Request

### Description

Currently flags `--proposer-settings-file` and `--proposer-settings-url` populate internal in-memory settings on runtime, however, we may want to watch for file changes and use the json or yaml file as a place to persist setting data.

### Describe the solution you'd like/considered

currently, one thought was to introduce a new flag to enable polling on files, this could be extended to other types of files but perhaps this makes the most sense. 

### Challenges

if we do something like this what might be bad is having this change override changes from the current APIs, so perhaps we need to have those APIs write to the file instead of the internal memory.

we want to make sure the file has to write access which may make things more complex. 

`--proposer-settings-url` would not be able to be updated in this case so how does it keep persisitence?
